Dear Mary Jo French:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment.
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation On 9/3/23, Staff 1 was verbally abusive and using profanity toward
youth. Staff 1’s body language was also threatening and was
posturing toward the youth. It is unknown at this time if Staff 1
made threats toward the youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on 9/7/23. CA reported the incident
occurred on 9/3/23 and Supervisor called her about 20 minutes
after it occurred. CA reported she watched the video and viewed
Supervisor telling Staff 1 multiple times to stop, leave the area, not
to open the youth’s door, etc. and he ignored all prompts. CA
spoke to Staff 1 via phone after watching the video footage and let
Staff 1 know he would be placed on leave until the investigation
was finished. CA reported Staff 1 kept repeating “watch the video,
watch the video” during their conversation as if it was going to
redeem him. CA reported Staff 1’s defense was “how can I be a
threat if I didn’t go in the room?”. CA reported Staff 1 does not
know how to step back from the situation. CA reported Staff 1
disobeyed multiple verbal directives from Supervisor, didn’t follow
the facility’s discipline policy and displayed unprofessional
conduct. CA reported there have been other concerns and
incidents, which have prompted them to provide Staff 1 with
coaching. In addition, CA reported Staff 1 just had anger
management coaching/counseling (3 sessions) within the last 2
months based on an inappropriate interaction he had with two of
his peers. CA reported in April or May 2023, Youth G was in his
room, with the door closed and the lights off. CA reported Youth G
was mouthing off to Staff 1 and Staff 1 key fobbed the door
because he said he felt intimidated. CA reported Staff 1 entered
the room, and a physical management of the youth happens, but it
can’t be seen because it occurred in the youth’s room, and it was
dark. CA reported Staff 1 did not follow protocol because he did
not call for back-up and he physically managed a youth who was
already confined to his room and did not pose a viable threat.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
9/7/23. Administrator reported Staff 1 has been provided coaching
for other incidents of a similar nature involving various youth and
staff at the facility. Administrator noted two years ago she was
present when Staff 1 became angry a youth wouldn’t give a pencil
to the teacher, so Staff 1 slammed his hands on the table and
said, “If you wanna go, we will go”. Administrator reported she told
him to “tap out”, which means to leave the situation. Administrator
reported Staff 1 had to be prompted multiple times before he left
the room.
2

Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
9/7/23. Supervisor reported on 9/3/23, she was busy with tasks in
the lobby when a Code 2 was called for the A-2 pod over the
radio. Supervisor called Staff 1 and asked him to report since she
was busy. Supervisor reported when she was done, she went to
the pod. When she entered the side door to the pod, Supervisor
reported Staff 1 was yelling at Youth B while Youth B was
quarantined in his room. Supervisor reported she heard Staff 1
yell things like “Y’all don’t run this facility!” and “I’m gonna fuck
y’all up!”. Supervisor reported she told Staff 1 to take a break,
which is how they tell staff to leave the area. Staff 1 responded
“I’m going to have [Youth C] clean up his milk” and began walking
the mop bucket over to Youth C’s room. Supervisor reported
Youth C was why the Code 2 was called, and he was already
secured in his room. Supervisor reported she instructed Staff 1 to
leave the area because Youth C was already secured, and all
activities needed to stop. Supervisor reported Staff 1 continued to
go to Youth C’s room and key fobbed the door, but Staff 2 was
able to open the door to the gym and pushed Staff 1 into the gym
since he wasn’t listening. Supervisor reported she was trying to
calm all the youth in the pod down because there was a lot of
yelling happening, so she decided to lock down the pod. As she
was explaining to all the youth why she was locking down the pod,
Staff 1 came back into the pod and headed towards Youth B’s
door. Supervisor reported Staff 1 was still screaming and said, “I
just want to talk to him” (referring to Youth B). Supervisor reported
she told Staff 1 to stand down and instructed him not to open
Youth B’s door multiple times. She turned to walk away, but she
heard a key fob sound on Youth B’s door, saw Staff 1 opening the
door, and immediately reacted and shut the door. Supervisor
reported Staff 2 grabbed Staff 1’s arm and took him out of the pod.
Supervisor reported after she calmed everything down, she
reported the incident to CA and CA put Staff 1 on leave.
Supervisor reported Staff 1’s actions caused her to be concerned
about Youth B’s safety if Staff 1 would have entered the room.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 didn’t take responsibility for anything
after the incident. Supervisor reported a few months ago, Staff 1
verbally assaulted her by yelling and cussing at her after she gave
him a directive from another supervisor. Supervisor reported he
was so aggressive, a cafeteria worker came out of the kitchen and
said “That’s enough. That’s your superior”.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Staff 1 reported he was second in command during his shift on
9/3/23, and he was asked by Supervisor to address the Code 2 in
a different pod. Staff 1 reported when he entered the pod, Staff 2
3

handed him some paper towel and said “can you get [Youth C] to
clean the milk up in his room because he threw it all over? He’s
not listening, and he’s upset, so he won’t clean it up.” Staff 1
reported he helped because he plays “the fixer” as he’s the only
male on shift and he’s been playing that role since working at the
facility when the “women staff can’t handle the male kids”. Staff 1
reported when he went into Youth C’s room to talk to him, Youth C
started cussing at him. Staff 1 reported Youth C wouldn’t clean up
the mess with paper towel, so he asked another staff member to
bring a mop bucket to the pod. Staff 1 reported he went to the
other door to retrieve the mop bucket, when Youth B began
banging on his door and yelling, he wanted to get out of his room.
Staff 1 reported he said “Y’all really gonna make me work today
huh?”. Staff 1 reported Youth B replied “You ain’t gonna work out
shit over here” and Staff 1 responded “I’ll work out whatever I
have to work out”. Staff 1 told Youth B “You don’t get to make the
rules and run the facility around here”. Staff 1 reported he said
some other things too, but he couldn’t remember what because he
was trying to regain order in the pod. Staff 1 reported when
Supervisor arrived in the pod, he left the pod and went into the flex
area. While in the flex area, Staff 1 reported he heard Supervisor
yelling “[Youth B] Stop!” so he thought it was a Code 1 situation
and went back into the pod to help. Staff 1 reported he wanted to
go into Youth B’s room to talk to him personally, as he has always
done it before, but Supervisor and Staff 2 told him not to open
Youth B’s door because they didn’t feel he was in the right
mindset to talk to Youth B. Staff 1 reported he key fobbed Youth
B’s door and Supervisor came up, shut the door and yelled “no!”.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 assisted him in leaving the pod. Staff 1
stated he left willingly and “submitted to [Staff 2]”. Staff 1 reported
“if he was in a rage, there is no woman who would have been able
to stop him”. Staff 1 reported he loves kids, is a coach, and would
never hurt any kids. Staff 1 reported shortly later, Supervisor told
Staff 1 to call CA. Staff 1 reported CA told him she watched the
video footage, didn’t like what she saw in the pod, and told him he
would be on leave until the investigation was done. Staff 1
reported he didn’t say or do anything differently than he has any
other time, but the difference this time is the pod was locked down
and under surveillance, so the video cameras were reviewed.
Staff 1 reiterated multiple times the only reason this investigation
is occurring is because he was “under a microscope” due to the
pod being locked down. Staff 1 stated “they’re women and I try to
protect them when I’m here, that’s what I always do when I’m on
shift”. Staff 1 also stated “there’s no policy saying we can’t go into
a youth’s room while they’re upset. I’ve always done that”. Staff 1
reported he doesn’t remember Supervisor saying much to deter
4

him from talking to Youth B besides “not now”. Staff 1 reported
when Supervisor “tapped him out”, he listened and went willingly.
Staff 1 stated “Nothing like this has ever happened with a youth or
adult at the facility. This was an isolated incident.” When asked
what he could have done differently, Staff 1 reported “I could have
coached [Staff 2] on what a Code 2 is because it wasn’t called
right. It caused me to get temperamental because I walked into a
chaotic situation that wasn’t mine to begin with. I came in behind
something I didn’t create.” He also stated “I need to get better at
not taking things personal. I’m a coach and I care, but I need to
not personalize it. I need to scale it back”.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 9/13/23. Staff 2 reported
she called a Code 2 on the pod and Staff 1 responded because
Supervisor wasn’t available. Staff 2 reported she called a Code 2
because Youth C was in his room in a “time out”, but he was being
aggressive, kicking the door and making threats about what he
would do if he couldn’t leave his room. When Staff 1 entered the
pod, Staff 2 told him what was going on and asked if Staff 1 could
talk to Youth C because he threw his lunch and milk all over his
room. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 obtained a mop bucket and as he
was walking towards Youth C’s door, he was cussing and yelling
back and forth with Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 yelled “You
going to be disrespectful to me? Come at me!”. As they were
yelling, Supervisor entered the pod and Staff 2 explained what
was going on. Since no one was listening or following directions,
Supervisor made the decision to shut down the pod. Staff 1
continued to walk towards Youth C’s room with the mop bucket,
but Supervisor told Staff 1 not to enter Youth C’s room. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 didn’t stop, was continuing to yell at Youth B and
began yelling at Youth C. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was being
aggressive, and Supervisor told Staff 1 not to open Youth C’s door
again. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 yelled “He’s not going to be
disrespectful to me! They ain’t gonna run this place. They ain’t
gonna run nothin’ but their mouths”. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
attempted to open Youth C’s door, but Staff 2 opened the gym
door and pushed Staff 1 into the gym, so he couldn’t. Staff 2
reported Supervisor was trying to get things in order when Staff 1
re-entered the pod. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 went to Youth B’s door
and began yelling at him, being very aggressive. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor told Staff 1 not to open Youth B’s door, and Staff 1
replied “He ain’t gonna talk crazy to me”. Staff 2 reported she
could not hear everything Staff 1 was saying because Staff 1 was
yelling. Staff 2 reported she and Supervisor both repeatedly told
Staff 1 not to go into Youth B’s room or open the door. Staff 2
reported Supervisor told Staff 1 “You can’t do this. You’re not in
5

the right state of mind right now. Stop!”. Staff 2 reported Youth B
was in his room and was standing in a defensive position like he
was prepared to fight with Staff 1 if Staff 1 entered the room. Staff
1 pushed Supervisor and Staff 2 away from Youth B’s door, key
fobbed the door and opened it. Staff 2 reported Supervisor
immediately shut Youth B’s door and Staff 2 grabbed Staff 1’s arm
and took him out of the pod. Staff 2 reported this is not the first
time he has shown this type of behavior in front of youth or staff,
but this has been the worst one. Staff 2 reported a couple months
ago, Staff 1 was aggressive towards her and another female staff.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 said “I’m a man, and you are women, so
you’re going to respect me” and “You’re not going to disrespect
me. You’re not going to talk to me like that”. Staff 2 reported a lot
of things he was saying towards Youth B and Youth C on 9/3/23
were the same things he has said to his peers. Staff 2 reported
she wants to feel safe at work, but she feels very unsafe around
Staff 1, who is someone she is supposed to be able to trust, feel
comfortable and be professional around. Staff 2 reported she’s not
sure when and who Staff 1 is going to put his hands on.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Youth A reported Youth B was in his room when Staff 1 entered
the pod. Youth A reported Youth B said, “if you put me on
sanction, I’ll beat my door down”. Youth A reported Staff 1
became really upset, was yelling loudly, and was making hand
motions. Youth A could not remember anything Staff 1 said. Youth
A reported Staff 1 opened Youth B’s door and Supervisor and
Staff 2 were trying to get Staff 1 away from the door. Youth A
reported he felt if Staff 1 got in Youth B’s room, he would have
fought Youth B because that’s how angry he was acting. Youth A
reported he’s never seen Staff 1 act like that before.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Youth B reported Youth C was in his room and was upset, so he
was throwing things around, and Staff 2 called a Code 2 over the
radio. Youth B reported when Staff 1 came onto the pod, he
already looked like he was angry because of his posture. Youth B
reported Youth C was mouthing off to Staff 1, which was making
Staff 1 angrier. Youth B reported Staff 1 left the pod, and when he
came back, he went straight for Youth B’s room and opened the
door. Youth B reported Staff 2 and Supervisor quickly slammed
his door so Staff 1 couldn’t enter. Youth B reported he felt like
Staff 1 was going to come in the room and beat him up due to the
way he was acting. Youth B reported Staff 1 swelled his upper
chest, his veins in his arms were popping and he was yelling.
Youth B reported he couldn’t hear much of what Staff 1 was
6

saying because he was yelling in the main pod area, and Youth B
was in his room. Youth B reported he’s never seen Staff 1 act like
that before.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Youth C reported he couldn’t remember anything that happened
or anything that was said on 9/3/23 because he was enraged and
having his own issues at the time.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Youth D reported he was sitting in the pod when he heard yelling
from a lot of different voices. He reported he could not remember
who was yelling or what they were yelling. Youth D reported
Supervisor told everyone to go to their rooms because she was
locking down the pod. Youth D reported he doesn’t remember
anything that happened during the incident besides people yelling.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/7/23.
Youth E reported on 9/3/23 Staff 1 was very angry, which she
knew because his chest was puffed up. Youth E reported he
looked like he wanted to hit Youth B and she believes if he would
have gotten in the room, he would have beaten Youth B up. Youth
E could not remember anything Staff 1 said during the incident.
Youth H was no longer at the facility at the time of the
investigation.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 9/3/23 was reviewed. Youth A, Youth D, Youth
E, Youth F and Youth H are in the main pod area with Staff 1.
Youth B is in his room looking out the window facing the pod. Staff
1 is seen walking around in the pod and he is talking, but it is
unclear what he is saying or who he is talking to. He walks to the
door and gets the mop bucket brought to him by another staff. He
begins walking with the mop bucket towards Youth C’s room at
the other end of the pod. As he walks past Youth B’s room, it
looks like Youth B is banging on his door. Staff 1 turns to Youth
B’s room and says “Y’all gonna make me work out now huh?”.
Youth B says “Workin out on who?” and Staff 1 replies “On
whoever I gotta work out on”. Youth B says “You ain’t gonna work
out on me” and Staff 1 replies “Shiiit, how much you wanna bet?”.
Youth B says “I’ll bet” but it’s unclear what amount he says. Then
Staff 1 says “okay, let’s get it. If they callin’ me down there, I’m
doin’ what the fuck I have to do. I promise you.” Youth B continues
to talk but it’s unclear what he says. Then Staff 1 begins yelling
loudly (unclear what he is saying), walks towards Youth B’s door
7

and stands in front of his door continuing to yell. Supervisor and
Staff 1 are seen coming into view of the camera and go stand in
between Staff 2 and Youth B’s door. Staff 2 is still yelling loudly,
and he is heard saying “We will see”. Supervisor or Staff 1 tells
Staff 2 to “Take a break” and Staff 1 begins walking towards the
mop bucket. Staff 1 puts up a poster board on Youth B’s window,
while Supervisor is heard telling Staff 1 “Take a break”. Staff 1
takes the mop bucket and walks towards Youth C’s room, with
Staff 2 closely behind him. Supervisor again says, “Take a break”
and either Staff 2 or Supervisor say “Take a break, come on, not
now, not now. Come on [Staff 1] take a break”. However, Staff 1
remains in the pod by Youth C’s door with Staff 2 by him.
Supervisor begins walking over while Staff 2 key fobs the door by
Youth C’s room and pushes Staff 1 out the door. As Staff 1 exits
he says “man, y’all trippin’”. Staff 2 and Supervisor are at the end
of pod by Youth C’s room talking. It is unclear if they are talking to
each other, talking to Youth C or both. Then they turn and begin
talking to Youth D. It is unclear what they are discussing because
there is yelling coming from other youth, and then loud banging
noises. One of the youth in their rooms yells “Let me out!” but it is
unclear who. Then Supervisor is heard saying “I can’t right now. I
can’t, you have to listen”. Supervisor walks over to Youth B’s door,
removes the poster board and yells “Listen! I’m doing everything I
can”. The youth continue talking and she yells “Listen! Be quiet!”.
Staff 2 stands next to her. Staff 1 re-enters the pod through the
other side door, and stands in front of Youth B’s door, behind
Supervisor. Supervisor is yelling, but it is unclear what she’s
saying. She then says “[Youth C] don’t go there. I got a job to do. I
can’t let you out”. Supervisor motions with her hands and tells all
the youth in the pod to go back to their rooms, so they begin to
comply. Staff 1 yells “Y’all don’t run this facility man” then walks
towards Youth B’s door shaking his hand and yells “Hey! Y’all
don’t run this facility”. Youth A, Youth D, Youth F & Youth H
remain in the pod area, while Youth E is standing in the doorway
to her room. Supervisor yells “Let’s go!” towards the youth in the
main pod. Staff 1 continues yelling “You don’t run this facility”
multiple times and using hand gestures towards Youth B. Youth A
and Youth F wait by the side door of the pod while Staff 1 interacts
with Supervisor. Youth H is on the couch by Youth B’s room. Staff
1 gets closer to Youth B’s door, while continuing to yell at him, and
Youth H stands up and backs away. Staff 1 yells “I run this, now
back up!” towards Youth B and Staff 1 leans over towards the key
fob pad and begins to open Youth B’s door. Supervisor turns her
head and yells “[Staff 1] uh-uh, no!”, then runs towards Youth B’s
door and attempts to shut it. Staff 1 holds his arm up and uses it to
push Supervisor back while he still tries to open the door. Staff 2
8

runs over to assist Supervisor, puts her arms around Staff 1 and
pulls him backwards. As a result, Supervisor is successful in
shutting Youth B’s door, and then stands in front of it to block Staff
1 from accessing it again. Staff 1, Staff 2 and Supervisor are
yelling, but it is unclear what is being said. Staff 1 uses her whole
body to pin Staff 2 backwards against a chair, while she holds his
arm. Supervisor yells at Staff 1 and says “You can’t do that”
multiple times while remaining in front of Youth B’s door. Staff 2
holds Staff 1’s arm and pulls him out of the pod area while he
walks behind her.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Juvenile Transition Center Code of Ethics (12/20/21)
outlines the standards for professional relationships and
professional conduct with youth, the public and other
employees within the facility. Any behavior displayed by a
staff member which is indicative of unprofessional
relationships is prohibited. Serving as a negative role model
to residents through individual actions (i.e. swearing,
breaking facility rules, etc.) is prohibited. It also outlines
P.E.E.C. (Professionalism, Emotional Control, Extenuating
Circumstances and Confidence) – an employee’s guide to
self-control. It notes staff should not take acting out
personally and staff must learn to respond effectively to
acting out behaviors. It notes staff might experience
agitation, anxiety, anger, or fear in a crisis, but must be
able to monitor their own feelings and maintain emotional
control. It notes staff are to maintain appropriate emotional
responses by using Handle with Care De-escalation
techniques. Lastly, the document also outlines expectations
for Juvenile Detention Officers/Shift Leads, which includes
not swearing, yelling, using crude language, arguing, or
talking down to residents or staff.
o Muskegon County Juvenile Transition Center Code
of Ethics Acknowledgement Receipt signed by Staff
1 on 7/15/21 and Code of Conduct
Acknowledgement Receipt signed by Staff 1 on
2/6/22.
• Email from CA dated 9/7/23 states “Staff 1 has been
coached and trained on verbal de-escalation and regulating
his responses throughout his employment at the facility.
Staff 1 was disciplined for similar behavior against
coworkers in June 2023. Due to his outburst and a pattern
of negative emotional regulation, a condition of his
discipline was a mandatory referral to the Employee
9

Assistance Program (EAP) to support and assist him on
managing his emotions”. Staff 1 completed the counseling
per email notification (below).
o Email from Human Resources Manager dated
7/26/23 stating Staff 1 completed his mandatory
referral process.
• Staff 1 completed Handle with Care training on 7/25/22 and
7/20/23, which includes verbal de-escalation training as
well as verbal and physical interventions with youth. Staff 1
has 2 disciplinary actions and 9 coaching sessions in his
employee file. Concerns like those in this investigation are
outlined below:
o Notice of Suspension without pay (6/23/23-6/24/23)
due to Staff 1 displaying unprofessional conduct
while on duty as an acting lead at the facility.
Referral was made to the Employee Assistance
Program. Notes on 6/20/23, employees reported
Staff 1 used aggressive and unprofessional
language and behavior in the breakroom. It was
reported Staff 1 was abrasive in his physical and
verbal demeanor, was loud, and made gender
comments and threats towards female employees.
In the summary of Staff 1’s response, he reported
his voice was elevated, but denied making any
gender-based comments or threats. Staff 1 reported
he could have handled the situation better and
admitted he got triggered.
o 8/29/23 – Teacher reported a concern to CA
regarding an interaction she had with Staff 1.
Teacher reported she motioned for Staff 1 to stop
tapping a desk and he responded verbally
aggressively and said he “was a grown man and
could do what he wanted”. Staff 1 reported “he could
have reacted better and used a more appropriate
tone but overshadowed the ownership by
complaining about minor issues he’s had with
Teacher in the past.” CA expressed expectations of
proper communication (professional and respectful)
moving forward.
o 8/29/22 – coaching session with Staff 1 regarding
receiving feedback and emotional responses.
o 9/1/23 – coaching session with Staff 1 regarding
Staff 1 making gender comments about himself
during interactions with Teacher earlier in the week.
10

Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage reviewed, and
documentation reviewed, Staff 1 does not demonstrate he is
emotionally stable to perform his assigned duties. Staff’s
inappropriate and aggressive interactions with youth and staff
have been well documented by the facility and the facility has
followed through with coaching, training, and a referral for
counseling sessions with the Employee Assistance Program.
Unfortunately, none of these avenues have resulted in long-term
changes for Staff 1 and Staff 1 fails to fully take responsibility or
recognize how his actions affect others, even after watching the
video footage with Consultant. In addition, Staff 1 demonstrates a
pattern of behavior in which he has repeatedly violated multiple
areas of the Code of Conduct for employees, specifically related
to professional relationships and emotional control, which are
outlined above.
Consultation:
• CA reported on 9/13/23 they intend to have Staff 1
complete a psychological evaluation before having any
contact with youth, which DCWL is in support of.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
